t: Psalm 69
An Urgent Plea for Help in Trouble
To the Chief Musician. Set to “The Lilies.” A Psalm of David.
Save*pn me, O God! For*ld the waters have come up to my*i neck.
I*ld sink in deep mire, Where*ld there*i is*i no standing; I*ld have come into deep waters, Where*ld the floods overflow me.
I*ld am weary with my crying; My*ld throat is dry; My*ld eyes fail while I wait for my God.

Those*ln who hate me without a cause Are*ld more than the hairs of my head; They*ld are mighty who would destroy me, Being*ild my enemies wrongfully; Though*ld I have stolen nothing, I*ld still*i must restore it.*i
O*ln God, You know my foolishness; And*ld my sins are not hidden from You.
Let*ld not those who wait for You, O Lord God*s of hosts, be ashamed because of me; Let*ld not those who seek You be confounded because of me, O God of Israel.
Because*ld for Your sake I have borne reproach; Shame*ld has covered my face.
I*ld have become a stranger to my brothers, And*ld an alien to my mother’s children;
Because*ld zeal for Your house has eaten me up, And*ld the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.
When*ld I wept and*i chastened*i my soul with fasting, That*ld became my reproach.
I*ld also made sackcloth my garment; I*ld became a byword to them.
Those*ld who sit in the gate speak against me, And*ld I am*i the song of the drunkards.
But*ln as for me, my prayer is*i to You, O*ld Lord,*s in*i the acceptable time; O*ld God, in the multitude of Your mercy, Hear*ld me in the truth of Your salvation.
Deliver*ld me out of the mire, And*ld let me not sink; Let*ld me be delivered from those who hate me, And*ld out of the deep waters.
Let*ld not the floodwater overflow me, Nor*ld let the deep swallow me up; And*ld let not the pit shut its mouth on me.
Hear*ln me, O Lord,*s for Your lovingkindness is*i good; Turn*ld to me according to the multitude of Your tender mercies.
And*ld do not hide Your face from Your servant, For*ld I am in trouble; Hear*ld me speedily.
Draw*ld near to my soul, and*i redeem it; Deliver*ld me because of my enemies.
You*ln know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; My*ld adversaries are*i all before You.
Reproach*ld has broken my heart, And*ld I am full of heaviness; I*ld looked for*i someone*i to take pity, but there*i was*i none; And*ld for comforters, but I found none.
They*ld also gave me gall for my food, And*ld for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
Let*ln their table become a snare before them, And*ld their well-being a trap.
Let*ld their eyes be darkened, so that they do not see; And*ld make their loins shake continually.
Pour*ld out Your indignation upon them, And*ld let Your wrathful anger take hold of them.
Let*ld their dwelling place be desolate; Let*ld no one live in their tents.
For*ld they persecute the ones*i You have struck, And*ld talk of the grief of those You have wounded.
Add*ld iniquity to their iniquity, And*ld let them not come into Your righteousness.
Let*ld them be blotted out of the book of the living, And*ld not be written with the righteous.
But*ln I am*i poor and sorrowful; Let*ld Your salvation, O God, set me up on high.
I*ld will praise the name of God with a song, And*ld will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
This*ild also shall please the Lord*s better than an ox or*i bull, Which*ld has horns and hooves.
The*ld humble shall see this*i and*i be glad; And*ld you who seek God, your hearts shall live.
For*ld the Lord*s hears the poor, And*ld does not despise His prisoners.
Let*ln heaven and earth praise Him, The*ld seas and everything that moves in them.
For*ld God will save Zion And*ld build the cities of Judah, That*ld they may dwell there and possess it.
Also,*ld the descendants of His servants shall inherit it, And*ld those who love His name shall dwell in it.
